availability.p: © Duke Databank of Documentary Papyri. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 License.

revisionDesc.change: Finalized - Ready. Between the submission by Hickey and its votes a further submission with a correction to line 18 had been made and finalized. I think I have managed to knit both submissions together sufficiently so that nothing from either of them has been lost.
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Feed the corrections made to this text in the meantime into this entry.

Vote - DEFER - Regarding ἐπὶ σὲ τὸν ἁ̣π̣άντ(ων), I find the reading convincing in all respects except the first alpha of ἁ̣π̣άντ(ων), which, purely palaeographically, looks to me like an epsilon and not at all like alpha. For what it's worth, επαντ- for απαντ- is attested in P.Par. 21 bis.
Finalized - Ready.
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Fine
Submit - New reading at line 18 (from photo), discussed in Analecta Papyrologica 2016.

Vote - DEFER - The omission of τοῦ in line 2 was mentioned in the commentary to P.Oxy. 78.5175.2 and picked up already by HGV. I suggest that we mark it up thus <:τοῦ=P.Oxy. 78.5175.2n.|ed|:>. In line 18, I agree that a corrupted formula probably lurks there. I have trouble, however, seeing all of τὸν πάντων. Before the sigma of σωτῆρα there appears to be tau (perhaps raised?), and after the nu of τὸν, the letter looks more like alpha than pi. I would therefore be slightly more inclined to print ἐπὶ σὲ τὸν ἁ̣π̣άντ(ων), but even this I am not entirely satisfied with (the pi, for example, is exceedingly difficult to see). In short, I agree that the writer has flubbed the formula, but I am unsure how to represent it. Next voters? Also, if accepted, the new reading should be tagged appropriately.
Submit - Added a missing word (l. 2) and suggested a solution to a problem in l. 18. See my notes for additional details.

Commit - Suggested a correction for a problem bit in l. 18 of the ed.; one expects a verb in the part of the line that could not be read (cf. comm. in ed. pr.), but I believe that this was inadvertently omitted. The string that I have proposed is otherwise attested (cf., e.g., P.Fouad 26.51). For the -ων in πάντων cf. these letters in τῶν δικαίων later in the same line. Image: http://ipap.csad.ox.ac.uk/POxy-bw/300dpi/P.Oxy.I.38.jpg
Commit - added a word (τοῦ) in l. 2 that is missing from edition; for image see http://ipap.csad.ox.ac.uk/POxy-bw/300dpi/P.Oxy.I.38.jpg
rationalized languages in langUsage
changed editor names to URIs
changed type=inWord to break=no
Automatically updated revision description
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; changed sic to surplus; moved title/@n to idno
Added language la-Grek
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
Automated split from transcoder files

div.ab:
Γναίωι ΟὐεργιλίωιΟὐεργελίωι Καπίτωνικαπιτωνιω,
παρὰ Τρύφωνος τοῦ Διονυσίου τῶν ἀπʼ Ὀξυρύγ
χων πόλεως. Σῦρος Σύρου ἐνεχείρισεν
τῇ γυναικί μου Σαραεῦτι Ἀπίωνος τῶι ζ ἔτει
Τιβερίου Κλαυδίου Καίσαρος Σεβαστοῦ Γερμανικοῦ
Αὐτοκράτορος διʼ ἐγγύουἐνγύου ἐμοῦ ὃ ἀνῄρηταιἀνείρηται ἀπὸ
κοπρίας ἀρσενικὸν σωμάτιον, ᾧ ὄνομα Ἡρακλᾶς,
ὥστε τροφεῦσαι. τοῦσου οὖν σωματίου τετελευτηκό
τος, καὶ τοῦ Σύρου ἐπικεχειρηκότος ἀποσπάσαι
εἰς δουλαγωγίαν τὸν ἀφήλικά μου υἱὸν Ἀπίωνα,
καθὰ παρῆλθον ἐπὶ τοῦ γενομένου τοῦ νομοῦ
στρατηγοῦ Πασίωνος, ὑφʼ οὗ καὶ ἀποκατεστάθη μοι
ὁ υἱὸς Ἀπίων ἀκολούθως τοῖς ὑπὸ σοῦ τοῦ εὐερ
γέτου προστεταγμένοις καὶ τοῖς γεγονόσι, ὑπὸ τοῦ
Πασίωνος ὑπομνηματισμοῖς. τοῦ δὲ Σύρου
μὴ βουλομένου ἐνμεῖναι τοῖς κεκριμένοις
ἀλλὰ καὶ καταργοῦντός με χειρότεχνον ὄντα,
ἐπὶ σὲ τὸν πάντωνἐπὶ σὲ τοευνω τὸν σωτῆρα τῶν δικαίων τυ
χεῖν. εὐτύχει.
